review.reviewBody: He loves laying down in the trailer and can see out in all directions!

review.reviewBody: Soft, great foam density offering maximum comfort on trail rides, and easy to wipe down after muddy paws. This bed fits perfectly and is a must have accessory for the bark ranger. Only wish it can standard with the carrier.
review.name: Perfect fit, easy wipe down, plush

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit that adds to the comfort for my senior fella.
review.name: Have bed will travel.

review.reviewBody: We recently purchased the Burley Pet Trailer XL and added the Pet Bed for comfort. Our King Charles Cavaliers love it. Good quality product for a reasonable price.
review.name: Comfy Bed

review.reviewBody: The bed is great and fits in my Tail Wagon wonderfully! It really takes the bumps and vibrations away! Be cautious of using this bed with a taller dog so you don’t cramp the headspace.
review.name: Bed for Tailwagon

review.reviewBody: Recently purchased the Burley pet bed for the Bark Ranger. I am very pleased with the quality of the pet bed and how it fits perfectly in the buggy. My dogs are enjoying our little adventures together. Thank you!
review.name: My dogs are riding in style and comfort

review.reviewBody: We love our Bark Ranger but unfortunately our pup scratched his way out as we were using it for a kennel when traveling. Fortunately, Burley replacement covers are available. It took a little effort to replace it but it’s totally worth it and we are back adventuring again!
review.name: Replacement Cover

review.reviewBody: Fits great, gives my dog some extra padding on our rides.
review.name: Fits great, gives my dog

review.reviewBody:
I had originally purchased the pet bed for our Tail Wagon. It is too large for the Tail Wagon and there should me a smaller one made to fit that smaller trailer. 

We also have a Bark Ranger XL and it fits that trailer perfectly. Like other commenters, it seems to me that it should come with the Bark Ranger. Seems like an essential ingredient for basic comfort.
review.name: Pet Bed

name: Pet Bed

description: Buy the Burley Bike Trailer Dry Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Bike Trailer Dry Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Burley Bike Trailer Dry Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Very well made. Used it as storage bin to save space in my tent.
review.name: Dry bag

review.reviewBody: Easy to put together, lightweight, and holds a lot of stuff. Very durable. I have not used it in the rain/wet climate yet.
review.name: Dry Bag

review.reviewBody: A perfect complement to my Burley Coho XC trailer. It’s a nice fit into the trailer with a little bit of room on the edges. If you want to talk, some other goodies in the rolltop works well, but the clips on the side may not be in the best position. Otherwise, a great light weight bag to keep my gear dry on weekend trips to the Cape and Islands in northern Vermont. Nice being able to get on a ferry with a trailer and not need a car reservation and be able to carry everything you need rain or shine.
review.name: Almost Perfect

review.reviewBody: The single wheel trailer is really well designed. I love how you can disassemble it and fit it in a compact car to transport to your next adventure. Assembly was pretty quick and easy. Customer support for a defect was great. Once you get moving you don’t even recognize it’s behind you, until you get to a hill, but that’s part of biking. It would be great if the cargo area was about 6 inches longer for the things that I do.
review.name: Well designed

review.reviewBody: The dry bag is sturdy and seems well made. The instruction sheet that came with it was absolutely useless. I have still not figured out how the straps are supposed to work. What's the point of printing a microscopic drawing in the middle of a big empty sheet?
review.name: Well made, no docs

review.reviewBody:
I purchased this bag for bike packing with the Coho XC, which seems to be made to fit into and yet the design is very poor for this use. 
We did 334.5 miles from Pittsburg to DC and this bag did great when it came to keeping things dry and giving me a big space to pack my gear into but every time I had to get in and out of it it was a major pain! The clips are attached to the bottom of the bag and when buckled together it falls right on the frame of the trailer so I had to try to pull the bag up out of the trailer to get the clip, which would fall down to the bottom to clip it back up as well as to get it unclipped. I would not buy this bag again because of that, I would find one that clips closed closer to the top.
review.name: Poor Design

review.reviewBody: They work awesome kept my gear dry and clean excellent protection
review.name: Carry all

review.reviewBody: I use the dry bag to go to the grocery store or run errands. I can fit ~4 large grocery bags in there, or a gallon of milk and three bags. It keeps things dry and clean. The fabric is heavy and stiff, so it is a bit of a pain to fold over and clip.
review.name: Coho XC Dry Bag

review.reviewBody: Nice durable bag that protects your gear from the elements.
review.name: Jackson

review.reviewBody: Quality was excellent. fit right in my cart. ready to go try it out
review.name: Dry Bag

name: Bike Trailer Dry Bag

hasVariant.description: Buy the KEEN Hyperport H2 Sandal - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I got to know who was behind the quality control by "Made in Cambodia" 

The fit and arch support are good. The foot bed is a little hard.
review.name: Finally a Pair of Good Sandal

review.reviewBody: Great looking shoes but run very large. I wear a 9 or 9.5 and ended up w a size 8. The back heel of the shoe goes up rather high as well if you have skinny heels, it will slide up and down.
review.name: A few problems

review.reviewBody: After a few times wearing them, these sandals are comfortable and supportive. Easy on, easy off and no tie front is great as well as the soft back. I'm happy with the color and look of the shoe, well designed and functional.
review.name: Supportive and Steady

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Reading the reviews, I was nervous about getting a pair. I ordered my standard size and they fit perfectly. Even by Keen standards these are profoundly comfortable shoes. They are light, breezy, and bouncier than any pair of Keens I've had. It's easy to walk all day wearing these, and no, they do not make my feet sweaty. I could not be happier.
review.name: SUPER comfortable

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable and the cushion is wonderful. Wish that the tread was a little more like newports.
review.name: Super comfortable and the cushion

review.reviewBody: These are the most comfortable shoe I have ever worn. I thank my daughter for suggesting them to me.
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: For years I couldn’t find an open Keen sandal that I could wear with my orthotics. Very happy to find these. It’s the vertical piece behind the heel that makes all the difference.
review.name: Good looking, super light and very comfy.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these new Keen Hyperport shoes. Very lightweight but supportive. Great in and out of the water, not hot which is helpful here in Florida. The squishy sole is really comfortable.
Shoes have a wide toe box with good support and flexibility for my feet. Good so far
review.name: Good water shoes

review.reviewBody: These are good, but the one issue I am having is the stiching at the heal is causing a blister on my ankle. I tried wearing them loose, I tried synching them up, no success. Maybe I just need to build ankle calluses.
review.name: Good, but....

name: Hyperport H2 Sandal - Women's

review.reviewBody: Surprisingly durable considering how thin they are, keep you cool and dry fast, cut my knee on some rock but the pants never got cut or ripped, dropping a star only because the stitching around the waistband was coming undone like crazy on the first wear, but overall great pants
review.name: Super light and comfortable!

review.reviewBody: Got these for warm season hiking and approach/ bouldering, and camp lounging. Haven't tested yet, as I just got them. But putting them on out of the package, they're soft and comfy, lightweight and just stretchy enough. Based on some sizing research, I got the smalI even though I'm 6'-0" 160 lbs and usually wear 32W/32L or 32/34 pants. Legs are perfect length, a tad skinny, elastic waist is snug but not too tight. I would maybe try a medium next time, but I think I'm between sizes.

I’ve had these pants for a few months now and love them. They are extremely comfortable however they aren’t quite as durable as I had hoped. I’m not sure how but I’ve acquired a small hold in both the left knee and the crotch of the pants. Nothing a little sewing can’t fix
review.name: Extremely Comfortable

review.reviewBody: I bought the XL, and the initial fit was great, but they shrank after a wash. They still fit and work well for climbing. They?re comfortable but pricey, even on sale, for what they are. That being said, I?d buy another pair at this discounted price. I?d go a size up if you?re worried about shrinking, or just don?t dry them. I?m 6?2, so the length is good on me, but it may be baggy if you?re shorter. I also tend to have to pull them up before bouldering attempts, as they start to ride down.
review.name: Like scrubs

review.reviewBody: Awesome fit (5 10 160 pounds medium pants), slightly long but this is useful for climbing. Light weight fabric with a light stretch. Comfortable waist band and deep pockets. Stylist enough to be cool but conservative enough to wear anyplace.
review.name: Fantastic climb and chill pants

review.reviewBody:
I have been able use theses pants for about the last 6 months and man they're comfy! The pants are made up of a stretch cotton and have a gusseted crotch so moment and flexibility are not hindered one bit. Pockets are big and roomy. The elastic waist band is awesome and blurs the lines between sweatpants that I ninja up stone in or a pair of casual dress pants that I can wear into work on Fridays. All while looking presentable.

I have a size 34" waist and wear a large.
review.name: Great Spring/ Fall Climbing Pant

name: Roots Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Sweater is nice BUT size chart is VERY inaccurate! Says it's "relaxed" fit and the size chart says to buy a M for a 37" bust. However, the garment hangs straight but actually measures 45" at the bust! Now I'm stuck with an un-usable gift for my petite sister!  Because the chart is SO inaccurate and no garment measurements are given, I think Customer Service should update it's description and allow me to exchange this sweater for a small.  VERY DISAPPOINTED!
review.name: Sweater is VERY WIDE & NO exchanges!!!

review.reviewBody:
This sweater is boxy but adorable. I love the lightness and warmth of it. I have worn it with a tank top underneath and it really is not itchy. 
I do recommend sizing down. I am usually a Medium but got a Small and it is perfect.
review.name: Cute and not itchy wool

review.reviewBody: A nice somewhat low-key take on stripes.  Quality great!  Warm and versatile.
review.name: good fit, good quality

review.reviewBody: The sweater was fine however,  I find it unfair to have to pay for returns on clothing or shoes.  As a consumer it's difficult to know the correct size when purchasing online.  I can see why people order items from other vendors such as amazon where returns are generally free.  I will be hesitant to order from Backcountry in the future because of this.
review.name: Pendleton sweater

name: Bridger Stripe Sweater - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I've been using the  Continental Grand Prix 4 Season Clincher Tires for many years.  I've had the best luck with them in all road conditions and they just keep working for me.  I've tried other types of Continental Tires and many other Tire Brands but I've not had the luck I've had with these 4 Season tires.  You won't be disappointed unless you like having crummy flats on the rides and routes you enjoy riding on.  

Chuck
review.name: My favorite tire of tires

review.reviewBody: I use the 28's for light gravel riding.  Think Strada.  Conti's are the best.
review.name: Great tires

review.reviewBody:
I use these in 32mm on a Dean Ti all-road bike riding in and around Baltimore.  I currently have about 3,400 miles on the set and they are still going strong, reflecting only minor wear on the rear tire.  The sidewalls and beads are still perfect.  

I've never had a flat on these tires (knock on wood), and yet they are fast for a durable set of tires and durable for tires that are this high performance.  

I would compare their performance to the superb Schwalbe Marathon Supremes, which in the U.S. are way more expensive than the Conti Gran Prix All Seasons.
review.name: Ideal all-conditions performance tire

review.reviewBody: I needed a replacement for the Conti 4s, the 5000 had a lot of bad reviews. I have not had one flat, my main concern, but I did move from Boston to San Antonio and ride mostly on Greenways, which are a lot smoother than Boston roads. For a 240 g tire they are light enough.
review.name: Been Using it for 2 years.

review.reviewBody: I ordered a couple of these tires. What I received from backcountry was a couple of used 700/28 of this. The boxes where open and had been taped over, and the tires were zip-tied and you could see a little wear on them from being installed and then repackaged and returned. I'm pretty disappointed with backcountry. These would probably have been good tires for my bike.
review.name: received an open used return
comment: Did you report the problem?  How did they respond? Did you get a refund or a replacement?

name: Grand Prix 4 Season Clincher Tire

review.reviewBody: I love these so much! They fit exactly like you would think from the size chart. Also, they are so soft and cozy and warm. I actually bring them backpacking with me in the fall because they are so lightweight!
review.name: So Cozy and Lightweight!

review.reviewBody: Great pant but could really stand to be about an inch longer. I'm 6'1" and these are pretty floodin' on me. I get that joggers are traditionally cut a little shorter, but these are still a bit too short. Otherwise I nicely made and good fitting pant. The fleece is on the lighter side, but soft and warm.
review.name: Nice pant, but short...

review.reviewBody:
Man, I got these for wearing in cool/cold weather. They are extremely soft, and very warm. I find myself grabbing these quite often and not wearing other pants or shorts that I have. There are just some clothes that you get and they go to the top of the list for what you grab - these pants are that type.

I have searched and searched for joggers that fit well and are comfortable, and I finally found them.  Pretty much all of my jogger type of pants have one issue or another - you know calves that are too tight, waist is too high, and area or too are too loose - you get the drill. These things are just great. I usually wear these with a pair of short underneath so that air doens not flow too easily in the top area - with these I do not have to do that, but there is room if I want to do that.
review.name: Don't buy these, if you don't want to wear them all the time!

review.reviewBody: Nice fit and very comfortable. Just the thing for low thermostats and working from home

description: Buy the Sea To Summit ALTO TR1 Tent: 1-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: ALTO TR1 Tent: 1-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit ALTO TR1 Tent: 1-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I purchased the Alto TR1 after having a disastrous experience with the MSR Freelite 1. The Alto provides superior shoulder and headroom, with a well placed door. Its super easy to pitch, and the little triangular space that pops out on the otherwise rectangular floor space makes the tent feel roomier, and provides space for my dog or gear. The vestibule is large and the ventilation, overall, with the fly closed, is pretty good. I bikepacked in below freezing overnight temperatures, and there was a bit of condensation at the foot of the tent, and overhead - even with the peak vents open and the cover unzipped. However, somecondensation is always expected when there is ice on the outside of the fly. 🥶
I highly recommend this tent for anyone looking to lighten their load backpacking or bikepacking. The tubular storage pack strapped down nicely on top of my handlebar dry bag. Well done, S2S!
review.name: Well designed and comfortable.

review.reviewBody: I bought this tent almost 2 years ago, and am not mad about this purchase. Over the couple years I've owned it, I've used it 10-15 times maybe more not sure. So far it has held up very well. I like how it has three different bags one for tent, fly, and poles. This allows for packing it separate in your pack, or between two packs. You also have the option to connect the pole bag to the fly and tent bag to make it on unit vs three. Also these bags also can serve a purpose inside you tent as gear holders and the pole bag as a lantern which is cool that they have more than one use. However the lantern is a joke as it's hard to snap on and comes off easily, so a good idea just needs some improvement. I found when I first bought my tent that it was hard to pack up as I was folding it up, and then it was extremely difficult to get into the bag, same with the fly. After a few times I started just stuffing in into the bag like a stuff sack, works way better and can have it all packed in minutes. Another thing I love is I was on an overnight backing trip by the coast, and during the night it started to rain and continued till mid morning. I was able to take down my tent and pack it up and fold up my footprint all under the fly. After my pack was pretty much ready to go, still under the fly where it was dry, I then took down my fly and poles packed that and hit the trail! I did get a 2 person mostly to use as a one person and have plenty of room, but have once used it with one of my friends which was pretty tight. So don't highly recommend sleeping two unless you’re comfortable sleeping really close together. There is room for a backpack and some gear under each vestibule so completely doable. All and all I really like this tent it's versatile, practical, and light.
review.name: Love my Alto TR2!

review.reviewBody:
I finally took this tent out on its first trip last weekend. Pros: it is very lightweight and packs down tiny, can be set up quickly (once you practice it, it is not the most intuitive tent I've set up), and reflectors on the rainfly make it easy to see at night. Cons: it is so small - my significant other and I both have regular-width sleeping pads (20") and they take up the entire tent floor. You would not be able to fit anything wider than that. I would only plan on using this as a 1 person tent unless you are very friendly with your tent partner. We could not fit any gear inside the tent which was a big drawback for us. Because the tent is so light, it also feels kind of flimsy. I'm hoping that durability won't be an issue going forward.

I'm neutral on the light bar. It's an interesting idea and it does work but I wouldn't say that is a necessity by any means.
review.name: Light but SMALL

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very professional but also gave me personal service like I was their only customer
review.name: Very professional but also gave

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Easy set up and absolutely bug proof. Camping in North Florida for three nights was a breeze. Totally dry in a couple of downpours. Very pleased with the experience.
review.name: Easy set up and absolutely

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the tent. So well thought out. Genius really!
review.name: I love the tent. So

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] As an adventure guide I work with LOTS of equipment - from rock, tree and ice climbing, to caving, mountain biking, wilderness survival - I am constantly looking for the best gear to make my outdoor adventures enjoyable, both for my clients and for myself. When it comes to overnight and multi-day programming, I have gone through nearly a dozen tents over the past 20 years. Generally my go to brand for personal use has been Big Agnes. Until I tried the Sea to Summit Alto TR2. The Alto TR2 is easy to set up, works great for star gazing on clear nights, and provides plenty of weather proofing for rain and wind. As a semi-free standing tent, it is easy to move around when trying to find the optimal footprint, and set-up and take down is a breeze. The double-door vestibules mean I can store things outside of the tent and still keep them dry, or even cook over a stove if it is really pouring out. The light tube is a bonus for diffusing my headlamp light when getting ready for bed, and the unique 3 bag storage system allows me to stow gear in multiple packs or multiple places in my own backpack. This is a great help when I have to make room in my pack for carrying equipment for a tired client on a long hike. Although I currently have 6 other tents to choose from, I find myself reaching for the Alto TR2 every time.
review.name: Best Tent I Own

review.reviewBody:
The tent structure is sufficiently spacious, but it still feels small for two people. You can barely fit both person’s backpack in the tent. It’s just enough room for two sleeping mats. 

The light bar, as another mentioned, is unnecessary as most lanterns only require a loop to clip on. There’s one tiny loop at the center of the ceiling and it’s likely not designed for hanging your typical LED small lanterns. The light bar also only clips on via plastic snaps, so it won’t hold much but a headlamp, anyway. I can’t stand it. Mostly, it’s because it’s really difficult to pack it into two awkwardly designed bucket bags when they are both fully packed. 

I went out camping at a very dry, hot climate environment and there were a lot of spiky objects on the ground. When I entered my tent, I couldn’t even put my knee on the tent floor because the spikes kept poking through the floor despite crushing the whole ground free of spikes prior to set-up. When I got home, the thin tent floor was covered in those spiky objects. The tent floor is ridiculously thin so I have to get the tent footprint. 

Lastly, I don’t understand why the pouches are designed so snug. I spent 15 mins just trying to push both the fly and the tent itself into both pouches while the rest of my friends had packed up into the car already. I was left alone for 20 mins trying to pack my tent. Also can’t stand that there are 3 pieces of components when they’re all packed up. They’re not held very well and if the two straps are not tightened, they will come apart. 

Sorry for the rant. I’m just a bit frustrated at what STS sacrificed for weight and not for durability. I have a mild form of trauma from entering my tent now that I realize how paper-thin the floor is. I also don’t know where to put my lantern since it won’t fit through the light bar. Even if it did, it’ll probably collapse on me due to the weight. 

Thanks for reading. Hope this helped.
review.name: Great tent, if you’re camping at home, perhaps

review.reviewBody:
Overall this tent is fine. It's easy to set up and take down, the quality of the components is really nice and feels pretty solid. I do like that it's almost entirely mesh on the body which allows for great views from inside as well as great airflow. 

For backpackers I'm sure being able to split the components between packs is a welcome feature. There's also ample space to stuff your gear, and you can turn the little stuff sacks the tent goes in into more gear pockets. The instructions for setup are right on the gear itself so you don't have to worry about losing it or trying to figure it out as you go along. Although as I said, setting it up is super easy as there's only one pole and the stretch points are color-coded. 

I wouldn't use this as an actual 2-person tent unless you like cuddling with your travel partner, but it's perfect for one person. I can't imagine that two sleeping pads would fit together well at the foot of the tent without overlapping or pushing up against the walls of the tent but the really depends on your gear choices. 

I wish the poles were just a bit shorter so I could fit them more easily into my motorcycle's panniers. They only fit in the middle my top case which means I have to sort of tetris other things around them. 

Here's the catch: I have only used this tent twice, but on one such occasion it rained throughout the night. Nothing too heavy, but it was constant. I woke up the next morning to find that the water had soaked through the toggles you use to hold the vestibule doors open and dripped onto me and my sleeping bag. For a $500 tent that claims to be 3-season, this is unacceptable. This is definitely something that should be reconsidered or redesigned in some way. 

This tent also does not come with a footprint. The material at the bottom of the tent seems pretty solid though, so it's not much of a loss and some backpackers may even like the weight reduction. I think for the price it should still be included but maybe that's just me. 

I feel like I could have purchased a truly waterproof 4-season tent for much less. I'm going to manually do some waterproofing and give it a few more tries, but as it stands now the pros don't outweigh the cons.
review.name: Easy to use, light weight, cool design, but NOT waterproof!

review.reviewBody:
A delightful one person tent. Perfect for backpacking. Definitely the most roomy one person tent I’ve been in. I really like the height as I am not fond of low profile tents. 
Set up is a little bit more detailed than some, but it will keep you and your gear dry. I love it!
review.name: A delightful one person tent.

name: ALTO TR1 Tent: 1-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: My partner and I just used this for the first time on a camping trip with two dogs. The garage area was spacious enough for our two dogs. The second night it downpoured for 4 hours no water got into the tent except for a small drop from the top air vent. My biggest complaint is some of the velcro for the door zipper is already ripped off after one use. Otherwise the tent held up amazingly when we got stuck waiting out the storm.
review.name: Extremely spacious rain resistant tent

review.reviewBody: this is just 4 metal brackets?? how is this so expensive for 4 metal brackets???? No rubber feet in the box so now I have to go hunt down if rubber feet even exist for this.
review.name: No rubber feet??

review.reviewBody: I know exactly what i am getting everytime i purchase Thule products. They are well made, reliable, and fit as intended.
review.name: Thule is always reliable

review.reviewBody: Thule Kit 183049 is an excellent product. Fits perfectly on my 2014 Mercedes C Class. The mounting kit that bolts on my roof's "fixed" areas was easy to install. Stay away from cheap imitations. The Thule AeroBlade Edge 7602 Silver roof bars fit perfectly also.
review.name: Fits perfect on my Mercedes C Class Sedan

review.reviewBody: Great material for the job! Nice rubber cushion so it doesn’t  scratch or damage roof!
review.name: Great mounting kit

review.reviewBody: Fit on my 1998 4runner perfect…Thanks to folks @ Rerack Seattle it was great to meet them!
review.name: RERACK ROCKS IN SEATTLE/Renton

review.reviewBody:
This kit is a bit sturdier than the one I have now where the metal bracket doesn’t contact the roof but has a 1.5” rubber casket and a screw that goes through 460r. It looks better but feels a bit flimsy. I only carry a 25lb bike so it’s not a problem. 

There are couple of different options but usually this kit goes with Thule 460R Rapid Podium Foot Pack but it could be used without it.
review.name: 2002 BMW 540i E39

review.reviewBody: I have been using the Thule Fit Kit KIT3101. It works like a charm. My bikes are secure, even on the windiest days.
review.name: Great rack

review.reviewBody: I was very happy that someone was kind enough to give advice via the internet regarding Subaru Bajas because it was difficult finding confirmation on the Thule website regarding the best product to fit. I went with the shorter bars and am happy with the decision. This does the job. It fits snugly and looks great. I think I just raised the value of my Subie. The instructions were a bit ambiguous. It took some time to arrange the set up just right, but it's doable.
review.name: Works for Subaru Baja 2004

review.reviewBody: I purchased this after purchasing bars on clearance from REI. This made installation easy and the instructions were simple to follow. I had one questions and Thule support was great and was able to answer it within 5 minutes. I would recommend.
review.name: Works perfect for my 2004 element

review.reviewBody: I appreciate the system offered by Thule, however when I need a new component or adapter for the system or a new vehicle the website does not make it easy to identify. Once I get the new component the instructions for use/installation are not very useful
review.name: Functional but not user friendly

review.reviewBody: got to tell you I purchased a pair of speed goats and found the quality lacking. the insoles slip up on one shoe every time I wear them. the go down on the other shoe sometimes. the vibram sole is coming off on one. I've only worn them about a dozen times for casual wear. too bad, otherwise they seem nice
review.name: need better quality control

review.reviewBody: I've always swore by the speedboat line. Purchased may pairs of the 4's and 5's in wide. The 6 feels completely different and not in a good way. Stiff and uncomfortable compared to previous models. Why change something that was so perfect? Now, I'm not sure where to go. I see 5's are still available but not in wide. I guess I have to start over on my search for my perfect trail shoe. :-(
review.name: A Step Backwards

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of Hoka's (Hoka Arahi 6 was my first pair) and I was very disappointed when after hiking only 5.5 miles on a moderate trail the toe of the sole was peeling off... I've run nearly 500 miles the my Hoka Arahi 6's with no issues and I've run hundreds of miles in other shoes and have never had this issue. I don't drag my toe at all and this trail wasn't even that challenging or technical yet the Speedgoat 6's failed after only 5.5 miles!! This was very disappointing especially from a brand with the reputation of Hoka. It's worth noting that I think Hoka is a great brand and shoe manufacturer I love my Arahi 6's however the speedgoat 6 is just not it hopefully this changes!
review.name: Very Disappointing

review.reviewBody: You guys fixed the heel flare but the lockdown still leaves something to be desired. Midsole is nice and responsive but not sure it is soft enough for distances over 50 miles
review.name: Upgrade from the 5 but definitely not the GOAT anymore

review.reviewBody: Best version yet. Don't understand all the complaints. If you want mush for midsole, buy the Mafate Speed 4 or Zoom X Nikes. If you're a serious trail runner or mountaineer, and want a precise, nimble fit with excellent lockdown and traction, these are for you. More responsive than prior models and the platform is narrower. Toe box more forgiving. I had switched to Altras for 2 years because I got sick of Hokas narrow toe boxes but Altras just aint the same and the tox box of these is excellent. If you find these too firm, you're likely not running on terrain that justifies buying these because if you did, you'd find these plenty cush or you have some dainty, sensitive feet. These are best suited for any distance on rough, technical terrain, not buffed out flats. Switching back to Hokas for good!
review.name: The G.O.A.T of the goats!

review.reviewBody: I run 10 miles a day everyday except the days I run longer runs. I loved the speedgoat 5's. I hit reorder my last order and got the speedgoat 6's. (Which was NOT my last order) they were great at first, but after the first week of using them they now dig into my ankles (try running 25 miles with your shoe digging into your ankle, very unpleasant.) I tried adjusting the laces and doubling socks, nope. So sad, I really love the Speedgoat style, especially the rubber soles. The other styles have that stupid foam that wears down super quick. Needless to say, I am very disappointed.
review.name: They dig into my ankles

review.reviewBody: I bet I've had 10 pairs of Speedgoats. They were fantastic! I just ordered and returned the Speedgoat 6. They were huge and the construction was very poor. They should concertate on quality not how many crazy colors and patterns they can get on one shoe.
review.name: SAD SPEEDGOAT CUSTOMER

review.reviewBody: I purchased my pair of SpeedGoat 6's at my local running shop, they fit ok in the shop and generally they do fit my heel to ball well, the toe box feels tighter than it used to though. overall I think it has potential to be a good shoe but O.M.G it is stiff, I do not know what it is but I feel like I'm stepping on a board with a thin layer of padding while using these. Mileage doesn't help either, they seem to continue to be stiff after putting down miles. I'll probably go back to my other shoes and get a different pair of trail runners down the line, which really sucks because I was excited about these.
review.name: Very stiff compared to previous versions

review.reviewBody: Wore the soles off my speedgoat 5's so it was time to replace them. Tried the 6's and they feel very similar to the 5's which is exactly what I wanted
review.name: Love at first step

review.reviewBody: I wanted to like the sixes but had to take them back. I've been a big Speedgoat fan and usually love the next iteration. I purchased these from my local running shoe store and ran four miles in them. Immediately after my run, my feet were sore. I put my Fives on and felt a big difference. I felt the sixes were more structured than the fives and narrower in the toe box. I found it hard for my foot to settle into the shoe's footbed. The fives feel softer. I am still sticking with Speedgoats for my fall races; I am just buying another pair of fives. Maybe the sevens will work.
review.name: Staying With the Fives

name: Speedgoat 6 Trail Running Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the MSR 32ft Ultralight Cord online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: 32ft Ultralight Cord
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR 32ft Ultralight Cord online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This cord is an exact match for the cord which is used for tie downs for my MSR Advance Pro 2 ultralight tent. This cord is not inexpensive. But it is exactly what I need to set up a simple, ultralight system for hanging glove liners, etc. to dry inside this tent. I also plan to be able to use this cord for additional tie downs on days when the winter weather is particularly rough.
review.name: Exact Match for the MSR Advance Pro 2 Tent

review.reviewBody: Love that it's got the high visibility. Awesome cord
review.name: Best cord out there!

review.reviewBody: Very nice reflective cording. Matches MSR original equipment. Keeps you from tripping on your face in the middle of the night when you have your headlamp on.
review.name: Great reflective cording.

review.reviewBody: Less than 2 mm but 200 lb strength? I was skeptical but purchased this cord for our wilderness trek on The Great Divide Trail in Canada's Rocky Mountains primarily to hang food. On day 4 we were confronted with a bridge out across a treacherous piece of water and this ""cord"" became our lifeline. With a carabiner as a grip for my wife to hang on, I was able to wrap it around a tree and pull her safely through the torrential waist-deep waters. Needless to say, I now have a great deal of confidence in this little cord :-)
review.name: This cord saved us!

review.reviewBody: The cord is nice, BUT, there are FOUR 8' long cords, not ONE 32' long cord. Can not use to hang food as advertised unless your bears are extremely short. Buy the ""Tent Guy Lines"" instead, includes 4 ""CamRing Cord Tensioners"" and is less expensive. Look elsewhere if you need to hang food.
review.name: Expensive, and not one cord!

review.reviewBody: I have never understood why some tents/tarps come with a non-reflective cord...a sure tripping disaster for me in the dark. All of our tents and tarps have had their cords replaced with this super lightweight reflective cord. We also carry a small bundle as our back up rope which has come in handy more times that I can recall while in the woods. Our go to cord in the backcountry.
review.name: Reflective cord a must

review.reviewBody: Cord was of good quality but at the premium price, it doesn't compete with by the foot cord from the outdoor store.
review.name: Good quality but expensive

name: 32ft Ultralight Cord

review.reviewBody: I first used this on my gravel bike that I do 90% of my riding on. It lasted nearly 2 years (~7500 miles) before it needed replacement. I just put it on another bike for a 750 mile bikepacking trip and other than getting dirty (unavoidable) it held up great. It might be a little pricey, but it's comfortable and it really lasts. Definitely worth it!
review.name: Comfortable and super durable

review.reviewBody: This bar tape is extremely thick and tacky in the best way. Took all the chatter away on a 50 mile gravel ride. Also great for lunch rides because I prefer a more tacky grip than traditional bar tapes. Yes, the price and the installation are a bit of a struggle, but I believe this product's strengths greatly outweigh its weaknesses.
review.name: Extra-Cushy Bar Tape

name: Nastro Cuscino Bar Tape

review.reviewBody: Me encantó este traje de nieve para niños pequeños. Es increíblemente ligero y práctico, ideal para los días fríos. El diseño es precioso y se adapta perfectamente al movimiento de los pequeños, lo que les permite jugar cómodamente sin sentirse limitados. Además, los materiales son de excelente calidad, resistentes y cálidos, algo esencial para mantener a los niños protegidos en el invierno. Definitivamente lo recomiendo, ya que combina funcionalidad, estilo y comodidad. ¡Una gran compra!

review.itemreviewed: SuperStrand LT Plus Size Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Mainly a decent jacket, but I thought it would be a little warmer.
review.name: Lightweight Jacket

review.itemreviewed: SuperStrand LT Plus Size Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Great should season puffy. Perfect for spring and fall hikes, day to day adventures and everything in between. I wear a 4X and feel that I can wear a lightweight technical fleece under the jacket no problem. The colour options are great. 
This was gifted to me by OR.
review.name: Cozy and lightweight

review.itemreviewed: SuperStrand LT Plus Size Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love this jacket & the colour. It's very comfortable with lots of room to move on and lightweight!
review.name: Lightweight & comfortable

review.itemreviewed: SuperStrand LT Plus Size Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love that I can fold It up right into one of the pockets! I also love the weight, so so light I can't believe it! I'm excited to try it out in colder conditions. I do wish it had draw strings for the hood and around the bottom hence the lack of a star.
review.name: Love it so far

review.itemreviewed: SuperStrand LT Plus Size Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was extremely excited to see OR had women's plus sizing. I ordered a 4x, wanting to layer this with hoodies and vests. The body of the coat was sized/fit amazing. But the arms are horrible! They are closer to a 2x I feel. This past weekend I tried on a men's XXL in store and the arms had way more room, but wouldn't fit my hips. So with that I am returning it.
review.name: Hit and *sadly* a miss...

review.itemreviewed: SuperStrand LT Plus Size Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this jacket. Very lightweight, but warm. The color is beautiful. Have had so many compliments. Fits perfectly.
review.name: Beautiful color!

review.itemreviewed: SuperStrand LT Plus Size Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am an OR Climbing Ambassador and received this as part of my work with OR. That being said - it is one of my favorite insulated layers and I find myself reaching for it for every adventure. Its lightweight and super packable and great for everyday wear around the city. My only gripe about it is that it is a little fragile - but that's often the price you pay for lightweight gear. I would caution using it near pointy things like crampons, ice axes and rock climbing. Otherwise, a perfect layer!
review.name: Perfect Super Lightweight Insulation

name: SuperStrand LT Plus Size Hooded Jacket - Women's

hasVariant.name: Sleep Mask
hasVariant.description: Buy the Therabody Sleep Mask online or shop all Yoga from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the sleep mask to have.  It's so relaxing and the vibration helps with my headaches.   It fits me perfect, which is usually an issue.  So far it is very durable and I've had no issues.  It is well packaged and all around the best sleep mask I've ever had.
review.name: Great sleep mask

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really wanted to use this product to the fullest extent. I loved the way it fit with the adjustable strap. I also loved that it vibrated just a little but had multiple settings
review.name: Must Have

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super comfortable and completely blocks light. Fabric is nice and seems to hold up well. I wish the settings were more customizable but some make me nauseous. I’m usually using it when I have a migraine and it doesn’t make a huge difference in my symptoms unfortunately. I was hoping it would heat up but it is just vibrations only.
review.name: Good but I’m waiting for it to be great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The comfort is there, the effectiveness of massage is great! Love the fit. The material is excellent breathability and lasting ability. Look forward to my great sleep ability! Love it.
review.name: Great relaxation

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The mask is very comfortable to sleep in. I will say it is a perfect fit for my head I didn't have to adjust at all. The material is really really soft almost like sleepy with a silk mask but more breathable. I would recommend.
review.name: The massaging is just the right amount of pressure

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] [Gifted by Influenster] I’m actually not much of an eye mask person but came to enjoy using this. All the added functionalities make it interesting to use and is a great addition to my nightly routine.
review.name: Interesting Product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is by far the most comfortable sleep mask I’ve ever worn! The vibrations are super relaxing and my favorite part is that there is absolutely no light bleeding through, it really contours to your face. I have a flatter nose bridge so I was worried about that.
review.name: The Best I’ve Tried

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Overall was impressed. I had never tried anything like it. It’s super comfortable, & the material is soft. It definitely relaxes you, so I would say it’s pretty effective. It does a great job of blocking of the light & it has several modes to help you sleep.
review.name: So comfortable & relaxing

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The best sleeping mask ever!!!! Love the blackout design because I can’t have any light while i’m trying to sleep. So comfortable and breathable to wear and go to sleep in and can easily adjust the head strap to your liking without it pressing onto your skull. The vibrations are soooo calming and soothing that they instantly make me fall asleep. Love the travel pouch and I literally cannot wait until I get on a airplane and use this.
review.name: Fixed Sleep

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a game changer for my eyes. It’s sooo comfortable and soft. I don’t feel claustrophobic with it on and it’s like a pillow on my eyes. The material is so amazing and I sleep so much better with this
review.name: Help migraines go away!

name: Sleep Mask

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit and very well constructed! Exactly what I was looking for, very comfortable and windproof. The screen touch areas work fine and all around a great casual winter driving and errand glove.
review.name: Great gloves!

review.reviewBody: Great fit and feel. Packs a punch above its weight in delivering warmth. I especially like that I can use my phone while wearing them. I highly recommend them.
review.name: Great light weight gloves

review.reviewBody: I like, but love & miss the monkey fleece gloves, they were next level comfort + function.
review.name: Comfy

review.reviewBody:
The touch screen surface on these is terrible. I’m an urban cyclist in SF Bay, have not had them in any extreme conditions, and within 2 months of use, both gloves’ tips are useless at using a touch screen. Both of them appear to be intact on the surface, but neither of them work on any finger tips.
Otherwise they fit well, are comfortable and warm but the ONE thing they’re marketed for they failed at very quickly.
review.name: Touch screen control is terrible

review.reviewBody: An amazing pair of gloves. Perfect for daily exercise and outdoor activities.
review.name: Weatherproof apparel

review.reviewBody: Bought to replace a previous pair I’ve had for 16+ years, finally wore out the old pair.  These are much more modern, good grip, good for temps around freezing, but seem a bit smaller than expected.  Still works for me, and I plan on keeping them.
review.name: Nice gloves!

review.reviewBody: These gloves will not keep your hands warm if the temperature drops below the mid forties.  A total waste of money.
review.name: A waste of money

review.reviewBody: Great fitting pair of gloves. The fact that you can still use your mobile device is a bonus.
review.name: Gloves

review.reviewBody: I bought these gloves to replace a pair I bought a year or two ago, and I believe they've changed in the interim. I really liked my old ones, but these don't feel as good, with very pronounced seams inside the fingers. They're okay, but I think the pair I lost was of a higher quality.
review.name: Not like the previous pair.

review.reviewBody: Great gloves however not really thermal warmth.  Thinner fabric than expected.  Need heavier density for temps near freezing or below.
review.name: Great fitting gloves

name: Power Stretch Stimulus Glove

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very warm and cozy. Size chart put me in an L but I got an XL and I really enjoy the oversize fit. L would have also worked but been more fitted/cropped. XL is extreme coziness.
review.name: Very warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The quality is great! I love the holier and feel of this!
review.name: The quality is great!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really like this pullover, however too short, IMO.
review.name: Nice

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wanted to love this! It was sooo cozy, but it was far too short.
review.name: Very cozy, but very short.
comment:
Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.
We are very sorry to hear that the Women's Super Aros Fleece Hoody has not fully met your expectations.
 
We will make sure to forward your idea of extending the length of this product along with your feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about implementing an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.
 
If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via  https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST
 
Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received my first Marmot purchase of this fleece jacket last week. FINALLY a substantial fleece, which I wouldn't call 'heavy' fleece, as it's light but thick.  It's warmer than any of my fleece jackets from other brands and I love it!  I went by the size chart and my hip size fell in the Medium size range, though my chest was in the small range.  I ordered the Medium and it's big on me, but it's cutely oversized and I'm keeping it.  I'm 5' 9," 130 lbs.  I can wear something easily under it and even w/my LONG arms, these sleeves are PLENTY long. I could probably use a size small, but I'm already in love w/this one.  It has a nice kangaroo pocket and seems extremely well made, which seems rare anymore.  I'm very happy and may order another.
review.name: Substantial Jacket!

name: Super Aros Fleece Hoodie - Women's

review.reviewBody: I’m usually between Small and Medium sizes, with Kari Traa Perle I get medium for length and so they aren’t skin tight. I purchased the Fryd pant in M and it’s tight but not too tight. My only complaint is it’s short in the rise- like womens Kuhl pants. So on me it’s low rise. It’s a thinner slicker material that fits well under hiking pants and jeans so I’m keeping them. Just wish they had a couple more inches in the rise. In this style I’m between the M and L.
review.name: Smaller than other Kari Traa

name: Fryd Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: I just finished a 5 backpacking trip in the Wyoming/Montana Beartooths. This pack was fantastic. More room than I needed! Super durable and comfortable. I love the adjustability of this pack. I found myself adjusting multiple times on every trek to get the perfect fit and comfort, once I got it right I felt like I could wear my pack all day without taking it off, unlike everyone else that wanted to drop their packs during every stop. I will say, I wish it came in a smaller size to prevent overloading, I feel a few of the buckles and zippers could be eliminated to cut down weight as it is a very heavy pack for a female pack. The bonus is, it is a very balanced pack. I didn't think I would use the bulky lid day pack, but I did and it worked quite well. Thank you Mystery Ranch!
review.name: Great Pack!

review.reviewBody: Really appreciated how adjustable this pack is. It fits my small frame perfectly!
review.name: A pack that fits

review.reviewBody: I spent several days trying to adjust this pack so that the shoulder straps fit properly. It cut into my side boob, and no amount of adjusting the yoke / load lifters / arm straps seemed to make that go away. I returned this pack. I think there is a lot of thought behind this pack, and if it fits you, it would be a great contender. Unfortunately, the fit was wrong for me. My bust is an A ... so it likely didn't have anything to do with the bust size. Additionally, when I loaded it up with the anticipated weight, it put an extreme amount of pressure on my hip flexors. The quality of the pack is very nice. Just a fit / comfort issue for me.
review.name: Might work for some.

review.reviewBody: I am very impressed with the space of this pack. When it's full I carry 50lbs and it was more comfortable on my shoulders than my smaller pack that was only able to carry around 35lbs tops. The waste band is phenomenal! I do wish there were pockets at the waste band so I can quickly grab my phone or snacks but I do see that I can put one on there. Great color, very neutral. I took the top off to go exploring and it fit so many things, very convenient to have.  Great pack, I'm looking forward to using it again!
review.name: Space and Comfort!

review.reviewBody: Free! Get up To An Extra 20% OFF Coupons from coupon-bird. com (No space)
review.name: Brilliant!

review.reviewBody: The shipping address was completely wrong my order (my fault), but the staff was super helpful in correcting it. I love this bag! So many pockets and strappy things! And the fit is great!
review.name: Awesome Customer Service

review.reviewBody: The design is excellent, the construction is impeccable! I could not be more pleased with my new Glacier backpack!
review.name: Exceeds my expectations!

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'4" and love backpacking. Every year I go on at least one 1-2 week long backpacking trip. I've never had a pack that fit me and my gear until now. My first pack strained worryingly, was too narrow to hold a bear barrel and tent side by side, and left me looking (and sounding) like a prospector with gear clanking on the outside of my pack. My second pack was my husband's old pack, held all my stuff, but was so long that I couldn't tilt my head back to look up. Retail stores near me didn't carry women's packs in the volume I needed and store staff seemed baffled that I'd even ask. This pack fits me, fits my stuff, and isn't some heinous shade of pink or purple. I'm training now for a trip to Denali and I feel like an actual athlete with equipment that suits me and takes me seriously. It'll be a few months before I can give it a real field test, but so far this pack has performed well as I've loaded it up with sandbags to haul around the neighborhood.
review.name: Finally a pack that fits me - 5'4"

review.reviewBody: Originally bought this pack for an extended trip on the Colorado Plateau but ended up using it for the first 400 and some change miles of the AT when the other trip got canceled. While it was too big for my needs on the AT, I still can’t recommend this pack enough. The hip and shoulder straps never gave me any pain. They feel like they’re made from memory foam. I’ve had bruising in the past from other packs but this I couldn’t even feel a pressure point. Cherry on top was that after 400+ miles in rain, snow, etc. getting tossed around, sliding down rocks, it doesn’t have one loose thread.
review.name: 400 and change- not a bruise or a loose thread

name: Glacier 71L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody: I have relatively wide feet and after reading the reviews, I decided to size up. To be precise, I measure 23cm so technically a 6, and after going up a whole size, I found that they’ll be okay to wear with thinner socks (especially once I break them in). If you want to wear chunky socks, I’d probably go even bigger.
review.name: Go Up 1 Size at Least

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit and soooooooo comfortable.  I go in the mountains everywhere with this boot.  Because there are not a lot of seams, there is few , if any, places that could run my foot.  I have clocked many mile in this!

I got these boots for a trip to Iceland and ordered a half a size up from my normal 8.5. They were really, really narrow. I then ordered the size up but those were too big and I sent them back. I stuck it out and after a week these boots fit perfectly to my foot and I wear them every day. I’m now looking for some Spring/ Summer Sorels I’ll be able to wear every day.
review.name: Stick with them!

review.reviewBody: I love the way these shoes look and how lightweight they are - I kept my eye on them for almost a year before buying! But the sizing was all off for me. I am usually an 8, but the 8 was too big (particularly length wise) and the 7.5 was too tight all around :/ I unfortunately had to return them.
review.name: Sizing was off
comment: Hello Lisa, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our Women's Brex™ Boot Chelsea is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of Brex. I just bought a different colour. Excellent style, they fit perfectly
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: I really hesitated ordering these boots because of the negative reviews about narrow size.  I generally wear a size 6.5 in Sorel boots but decided I would be better off with a half size larger due to reviews.  They fit perfectly with my thick cotton socks. I don’t have narrow feet and I am happy. May order another as I love the salt color for spring
review.name: Order 1/2 size larger

review.reviewBody: Exactly as I was hoping they'd be! Need to break them in a bit, but they're going to be perfect
review.name: Beautiful boots

review.reviewBody: Leaving my review b/c I hesitated based on other comments. These boots are great, wore them in the rain and thro Gah puddles that came over the top of my foot and they kept me nice and dry! There were some reviews that mentioned sizing, so want to share my experience. All my other Sorel shoes are a 7 and that’s what I ordered. They fit great. Plenty of room at the toe and while they are slim fitting (people mentioned how narrow they were) they worked great for me even with thicker socks and I don’t have a super narrow foot. They also loosened up with wear. If you have a wider foot, may not be ideal but if you have a regular to narrow width, these work!
review.name: Fit as expected!

review.reviewBody: I typically wear 7.5 in shoes, 8 in boots. I ordered these in an 8 and they are narrower than most boots  but I have narrow-med width feet and they fit perfectly in medium thickness socks.
review.name: These are my new going to work when it’s snowing boots

review.reviewBody: Very hard to put on. Narrow in the toe box. Thought about exchanging them for a bigger size but they already look so huge! Returning
review.name: Look huge, feel small. Returning
comment: Hello Bina, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our Women's Brex™ Boot Chelsea is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: I definitely don’t recommend this garment. It is bubbled really badly like a cheap fleece.
review.name: Not up to expectations

review.reviewBody:
Great fit and comfort, but pills up everywhere almost immediately. Pills turn white and threads now coming apart. 
Fjallraven does not care.
review.name: Do not buy.

review.reviewBody: I’m 5’8 210 lbs. with a six pack. Wide shoulders. Size large Hoodie fits great except for the sleeves are too long. The waist of the hoodie also has no stretch so I can’t get it over my butt. The rim of the hoodie also has no give so I can’t put it on when it’s fully zipped. Quality however is great. Maybe more tailored for taller non muscular guys.
review.name: Almost a keeper

review.reviewBody: This jacket runs small. Order one size larger than you usually wear.
review.name: Order a size larger

review.reviewBody: Let me start by saying I love the hoodie. It’s comfortable, looks sharp, and the materials are all high quality. For some reason, the material they chose to line the hood and hem along the bottom with has no stretch at all. You are not able to put the hood on if it is zipped up. I think giving those areas a bit of stretch would be a big improvement.
review.name: Sharp! But could use improvements

review.reviewBody: I received my Övik Fleece Hoodie today and it's every bit as good as I hoped. The fit is spot on and the construction and materials easily justify the price. This is my first experience with Fjallraven and I'm very pleased.
review.name: Terrific service, great product!

review.reviewBody: Loved the design and fit, however the fabric began pilling severely after about a month of light (mostly around the house) wear. Unfortunately it now looks worn and sloppy. I would not recommend purchasing.
review.name: Not durable

review.reviewBody:
Best hoodie I’ve had in a while—and I’ve definitely owned a few. It is so soft and comfortable and fits perfectly—feels conforming but not at all tight or constricting. (“Athletic” build with broad shoulders and slimmer waist)
Function for the weather and fashion for a casual night out. Only worn it a couple times so far and have already had a few people ask where I got it.
review.name: Awesome hoodie

review.reviewBody: I love everything about this hoodie, except the double zipper. You want to be able to connect the zipper and zip the hoodie up without thinking about it, and maybe even not looking at it. Unfortunately that isn't possible with this hoodie. You *have* to verify that you've inserted the non-zipper side all the way into two zippers before you can tug one and zip up the hoodie. I would say I got it right maybe 3 out of ten times without taking a few extra moments to verify and/or readjust it. That might seem like a small detail, but I can almost guarantee that you normally operate a zipper on a jacket without thinking about it. As soon as you have to start wondering about the zipper on your hoodie, it gets annoying pretty fast. This morning I thought I had the zipper ready to pull and I pulled a few teeth off the zipper. So it's going back. I can't imagine this double-zipper setup lasting more than a few months since it's so easy to get it wrong and damage the zipper.
review.name: The zipper situation ruins this hoodie

review.reviewBody: Versatile hoodie can be worn with jeans or out on a hike. Not overly warm with breathable technology, which is a must for me. Love the zipped pockets and the leather detailing. G1000 reinforcements add to its robust build. One minor criticism is that the sleeve cuffs are a tiny bit too large/wide. Nothing major though.
review.name: Awesome hoodie

name: Ovik Fleece Hooded Jacket - Men's

Super nice well built boots, for the right feet 👍

Mine are not the right ones :(

review.itemreviewed: Techsun Wave Water Shoe - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody:
Runs 1-1.5 sizes small!!! 
Love the shoe, wish it was accurately sized. Runs nice and wide so your toddlers foot can strike the ground naturally.
review.name: Runs small!!

review.itemreviewed: Techsun Wave Water Shoe - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: Runs small.  Bought these for my Grandson in his regular size and tors were all the way to end.  Even next size up was too small.
review.name: Runs small

review.itemreviewed: Techsun Wave Water Shoe - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: Blisters formed after first wear. She was wearing them then when we got home is discovered a red sore on her ankle. First shoes we’ve ever had this happen. Scab took a while to heal and how I’m scared to put them on her again.
review.name: Hurt feet and blisters

review.itemreviewed: Techsun Wave Water Shoe - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: My toddler is a size 3. Ordered a 4 and still too small. The toe of the shoe is not forgiving for chubby toddler feet. The issue is not the width but the height. We have been stretching them out with golf balls stuffed into the toes.
review.name: Size up

review.itemreviewed: Techsun Wave Water Shoe - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: These are nice but the have scratched and hurt my daughter’s feet after one week of wearing them..
review.name: Good but not soft enough

review.itemreviewed: Techsun Wave Water Shoe - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: I bought these for my two-year-old granddaughter, she is very clumsy and needed a pair of sandals that covered her toes, I looked in all other brands and this one was ultra lightweight and very flexible. She had no problem walking in them from day one when they were brand new, they also look absolutely adorable on her, Thanks Columbia!!
review.name: Awesome for toddlers

review.itemreviewed: Techsun Wave Water Shoe - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: I love the fact that these sandals are easy to wash, they look amazing and they are wide around the toes!
review.name: Love these! Easy to wash and they are nice and wide for the little toes!

review.itemreviewed: Techsun Wave Water Shoe - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: Sad about the fact that they run very small. Size up. I was excited to receive these but had to return.
review.name: Too Small

review.itemreviewed: Techsun Wave Water Shoe - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: Awesome sandals for my little toddler granddaughter!!  Fit great!
review.name: Great service and quick shipping! thank You!!

review.itemreviewed: Techsun Wave Water Shoe - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: Runs Small. Great sandals otherwise. I will return for a bigger size.
review.name: Great Sandal, but runs small...

name: Techsun Wave Water Shoe - Toddler Boys'

review.reviewBody: I am an XL in most gloves. This glove runs especially small. Even compared to other OR gloves. Even after getting the glove on it felt colder compared to other liner style gloves I have. I went with the Backstop Sensor glove. I like the concept of this glove but I found the wrist way too small and the area between the index and thumb also too small. The space between the fingers fit well so I am afraid if I bought XXL (if they even have them) the fingers would be too long. Overall the mixed leather is nice and I’m sure it would be a durable glove, however the fit isn’t great.
review.name: Nice concept if you can fit

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) I had read other reviewers' comments about the fit, and thought I would be fine because I have small hands but they still feel pretty weird. Haven't tried them in the winter yet for the warmth Factor.
review.name: Fit is a bit weird

review.reviewBody: Bought a few pairs for camp chores and backcountry ski chores such as putting skins on and off and scraping ice, tensioning guy lines, tying boots, etc. They give incredible dexterity. The stitching inside is a bit annoying but I could have loved them if they were water existent. They will not stay dry for my uses. I intended to keep heavy gloves on and just use these for the small chores that require dexterity and then switch them out. I believe won't stay dry for even the shortest time. The materials are outstanding and luxurious. Wish they would have kept the water out! As far as size, I am a girl, 5'3" 118 lbs and the small was a good fit.
review.name: Returned them

review.reviewBody: Good quality, not my first or glovr and they are way too tight .
review.name: Sizing feel small

review.reviewBody: I love them. Amazing gloves for biking on cold weather. And of course, amazing for baselayer ice climbing! They fit perfectly on my hand...well design.
review.name: Versatile gloves

review.reviewBody: I was so excited when these were re-released. Great for xc skiing, and mountain biking. They are thin enough to allow dexterity for rope work. Lightweight.
review.name: Favorite Gloves!

review.reviewBody: I bought these for biathlon as well as warmer weather ice climbing. So far I've only used them for biathlon. Loading ammunition, swapping magazines and trigger feel are all excellent with these gloves. I've practiced in these gloves at -9 C and they are just warm enough. I plan on racing in these down to -10. I have no doubt they'll feel great once I get on the ice. A very slight con, and it could just be the shape of my hand, is that while all the fingers fit perfect I do have some extra material at the end of my thumbs.
review.name: Great dexterity and fit.

review.reviewBody: I have owned 3 pairs of these gloves. I really think these gloves perform great for ice, mixed, and alpine climbing. However, they are not very durable. The stitching on the fingers tends to fail relatively quickly. If you buy these gloves, you will likely want a needle, thread, and seam grip to extend the life of the seams. I would really like to see OR improve the durability of the gloves by making the leather slightly thicker, improving the stitching, and extending the thumb-index reinforcement higher on the index finger. The thicker leather used on the pinky could be used on the palm and other fingers to improve durability without too much loss of sensitivity or grip. The thin leather thumb-index reinforcement patch could be extended above the first and second knuckles on the index finger to reinforce the high wear areas on the index finger.
review.name: Great performance, poor durability.

review.reviewBody: Unfortunately, way too small for me... should have taken extra large. I am 6 feet tall and 180 pnds
review.name: Don't think I would buy again

review.reviewBody: I thought at first glance that these were not going to be warm enough for colder days of ice climbing but I am happy to report that is false. I wore these on a long rambling multi pitch in the Canadian Rockies in -15 celsius, switching them out while belaying to keep them dry and I was very impressed by how warm my hands stayed while climbing. Great dexterity and grip!
review.name: More than just a warm weather climbing glove

name: Mixalot Glove

description: Buy the Western Mountaineering Nanolite Quilt: 38F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Nanolite Quilt: 38F Down
hasVariant.description: Buy the Western Mountaineering Nanolite Quilt: 38F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I bought this for fast light adventures and after 3 summers my observations. 

Temp rating seems accurate. 
Packs up very small. 
It's a little long for me because I'm 5'5 but this allows me to bury my head in if I am chilly. 
Neck baffle is great! 
I put a sleeping bag mummy liner over my sleeping pad to make a nice sleeping surface. 
It took some practice to get the strap, the adjustor for the neck baffle and the neck snap figured out. I use all of them when it's on the chilly side of temps.
It layers with my other sleeping quilts/ bags and ice used it inside a double quilt with my partner who is a much warmer sleeper.
review.name: 4 year review

name: Nanolite Quilt: 38F Down

review.reviewBody:
Love them… but, I’m a size 14 and the XL is tight on my thighs. Also, I knew in advance they were shorter than usual (likely so they don’t hang down below the skirt), but as a 65 year old, I find them quite short! 

Also, wore the shorts and skirt on a cooler day than ideal and ended up adding leggings part way through the day. As I had 3 layers on now - shorts, leggings, skirt, I couldn’t tell at the waistline what was where and the skirt was a bit lower than ideal and got caught on my seat. Eek! Not a good experience. Lesson learned- don’t add leggings, and ONLY wear the skirt when it’s snapped to the shorts or the same may happen again. (Slow tumble over while at a stop!)
review.name: Love this skirt and shorts!

name: Sugar Skirt - Women's

review.reviewBody: Bring Back the B25. I'd buy ten pair. Everything else is poor substitute of lesser quality and durability.

review.reviewBody:
Love Carhartt shorts.  I wear them daily. Nothing breaths the comfort and durability.  But they keep getting longer and longer.  The 11" inseam is too much for me. I'm 6' tall and they are still too long.  

8"-10" inseam is more comfortable to me.   

Otherwise great shorts.

Very nice shorts. Well made and sizing is standard.

review.reviewBody: These pants are exactly what I was looking for. The material is soft and comfortable, they are loose but still cute, and casual enough to hang out in but also fine to wear out to dinner. They do run pretty big, at least one size up from my normal size. I liked them enough to buy another pair in black.
review.name: Love these

review.reviewBody: These were exactly what I was looking for as an everyday pant that is adaptable to the outdoors.  I followed sizing suggestions on here and went with the XS.  I’m long and lean and these fit perfect.
review.name: Comfortable and Sturdy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very happy with these pants. Fit great, look great. I have them in two colors so far. Totally worth the money.
review.name: Very happy with these pants.

review.reviewBody: Cute, comfy, and so soft. The real thing looks just like the pictures. They are a little big; I probably could have fit better in a size XS. The size can be adjusted by just tightening the drawstring.
review.name: Yes! To these!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are my favorite pants! The "cement" color is a perfect light khaki color in person. Have them in another green color. They hold their shape while having stretch and are soft. I have them in the XS size for a more fitted look (usually wear a sz 8-10, am 5'6", 160 lbs.). I'll definitely get more colors!
review.name: Most comfortable pants!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wanted to love these but they just weren't flattering on me.
review.name: I wanted to love these

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these pants! So nice I wear them to work. The material was a little heavier than I expected but they stretchy and comfortable. They feel nice and soft. Love the drawstring waist as I can adjust accordingly. Normally I am a medium but sized down to a small and they are perfect. Wish they had them in black. Nonetheless so awesome I definitely going to buy them in another color.
review.name: Love these pants! So nice

review.reviewBody: Im curvy and petite so finding the right pair of pants can be difficult for me. These fit so great! Quality is amazing. I plan on buying more in different colors!
review.name: My New Favorite Pair of Pants

review.reviewBody: Carve does it again. These are the perfect elevated travel pant that are incredibly comfortable at the same time.
review.name: So comfortable and flattering

review.reviewBody: Only 4 stars bc they run SO large. Great quality. SUPER comfy. Based on reviews, I ordered an XXS. I am 5’4” 115lbs 36x29x36. Pants are still a bit loose. I ordered the navy. It’s like a sueded fabric.
review.name: Great quality & SUPER COMFY

review.itemreviewed: Flex ROC II Lined Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Material is thin. Not only is the pants thin, but the lining is nothing but a very thin piece of fabric. In addition the zipper is of poor lightweight quality.  Also"Flex" in name suggest these pants has stretch. It does not. I get more flex in my Levi's.

If buying thinking of keeping warm, forget it. Look for something else.
