review.itemreviewed: Flex ROC II Lined Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excelent product excellent price good material awsome
review.name: Excellent

review.itemreviewed: Flex ROC II Lined Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These pants are durable and will fit over work boots. The material is not too thick and has held up after multiple washes. They have a slight stretch which makes them comfortable. These are worn at work on a construction site and they hold up.
review.name: Durable work pant

review.itemreviewed: Flex ROC II Lined Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great pants and the lining is wonderful. Ordered 36 inch waist. Unfortunately, the actual waist measurement is 38.
review.name: Great lining

review.itemreviewed: Flex ROC II Lined Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a perfect product. I am a fan of Columbia and Always trust this brand! Warm and soft - love it!
review.name: Perfect

review.itemreviewed: Flex ROC II Lined Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Sizing runs true, the liner is not bulky but very soft and warm. The lining of the pockets matcjes the pant lining. They are lined throughout with a black material but the waist and leg hems are plaid.
review.name: THE BEST PANTS

review.itemreviewed: Flex ROC II Lined Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have two pairs of the Men's Flex ROC Lined Pants, so I decided this year to get another. Instead of the nice warm soft flannel lining in my pants, the new pants only have the flannel for a few inches at the bottom. The rest of the lining is some kind of thin, slick material.

The worst part is that they've changed the fit from "Active" to "Straight."  I'm not exactly sure what that's supposed to mean, but on the pants I received, the rise is short, the pants bind in the crotch, and the waist is too tight.

These were my favorite cool-season pants, but I won't be buying any more of these.
review.name: They Changed It for the Worse.
comment: Hey there! We have three different types of Flex Roc Pants. To compare the styles, search Flex Roc in the search bar. It's possible you ordered a different model. Feel free to reach out if we can be of further assistance.

review.itemreviewed: Flex ROC II Lined Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Overall good pants but the flannel lining stops about 2 inches below the waist and up from the leg opening. It does have an inner lining but it’s a different material from the flannel. Which initially almost had me sending them back before I even wore them. I’d edit the description of these pants to insure people know what they are buying. Or better yet actually line the entire pant interior with flannel. 
   I work outside; hot, cold, rain, snow or sun shiny day. And it just so happened to be about 45F outside and laundry day the day they arrived. So I desided to give them a shot bc they had to be warmer than blue jeans. And turns out they were. While not as good as true flannel lined pants the do keep your legs warm to around 40-45F without a base layer underneath. But with even a light base layer these pants are good to around freezing 32F. Below that I’d go with a heavier base or something like the Royce range HEAT pants Columbia use to sale, what I had come to the website to purchase originally. 
  So as a pleasant surprise these pants turned out to be more useful than I had originally thought. So much so I’ve bought 2 pair of the tan and 1 black now. They have become my go to pants when the temp is 40-55F this winter. While I wish Columbia still sold the heat pants, these will do untill they wear out or I find a better option. 
  I’d probably give them 4.5 stars if they were fully flannel lined. But I have to reduce the rating a star for the misleading description of the pants. 3.5/5 stars.
review.name: Pleasantly Surprised Post Initial Disappointment

review.itemreviewed: Flex ROC II Lined Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Purchased these in 32x32. They are comfortable and fit just right. I like wearing lined pants during cold months because it's fewer layers to wear while keeping me warm. I would like to order more of these pants in different colors.
review.name: Warm, comfy pants without the bulk or extra layers

review.itemreviewed: Flex ROC II Lined Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this item last year and was really happy with them.  However, they have chanced the material that pant is lined with.   Previously they were a thick lining of felt, now they are lined with a very thin linning of cloth.  I have not worn them yet in the cold but based on the construction I do not think they will offer much additional warmth over an unlined pant.
review.name: Good fit, not very well lined

name: Flex ROC II Lined Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: These have been my go-to levers for years, simply because they are inexpensive, tough, and don't scar up the wheel or tire.  Interestingly, they are quite useful for other jobs as well - I recently had to change my fork seals for my motorcycle but couldn't find my seal puller.  Jam the through a box-end wrench, a bit of muscle, and out pops the seal without scarring the seat.  I've got maybe four sets of these scattered around my shop because I keep finding more uses for them.  Worth every penny.
review.name: Super handy, worth having around

review.reviewBody: I love this shirt. The only thing about it is, and i dont know if its me, but it has cuts where my garmin watch sits on my left wrist. They seem to line up with my wrist watch exactly. I have never had this happen with a shirt before, so im not sure if its a defect or my 7year old watch is more destructive than i realized. Other than that i absolutley love this shirt. The materials is in my opinion better than the columbia sun shirts i spend most of my summer outdoors wearing.
review.name: Good product

review.reviewBody: I’ve had this for a month or so. Feels stronger than those C from other companies
review.name: Great sun shirt. Feels more durable

review.reviewBody: I have several of these Sun Hoodies. I actually wear them most every day. I use the hood with a baseball cap to keep the sun off my face and neck. The fabric is very breathable and comfortable in warm weather.
review.name: Sun Hoodie is perfect for summer

review.reviewBody: An excellent garment. Highly breathable and surprisingly durable. Survived two days of bushwhacking in holy cross wilderness. I was impressed!
review.name: Simply spectacular

review.reviewBody: Works well for what I need it for...mainly working in garden in full sun
review.name: Good sun shirt

review.reviewBody: This is a great shirt. I bought four Tahoe 2 Sun Hoodies (another summer hoodie by a well known brand,) and two Backcountry Tahoes in the crew neck version. The Backcountry Tahoe Sun Hoodie/Crew are clearly the best. It's the material. It is unlike another the others. Super light, comfortable, but substantial. Way to go Backcountry. (I was going to buy another crew, but you sold-out of the color that I wanted!
review.name: Great Shirt! Better Than The Rest

review.reviewBody: Nice shirt, however at a $69 retail I won't be buying anymore.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: It's fine, runs quite large as others have mentioned, size down at least one size.  It's less expensive than other brands, we'll see.  In general, I will say that I don't know what happened to backcountry.  When you ask for help, or otherwise ask questions, they're generally unhelpful these days. Didn't used to be that way.  After the last experience I've decided it's better to just go to REI or some other brick and mortar store where they are helpful (backcountry in store wasn't) have more flexible policies, and want customers.  I just dropped $1k at REI, that could have been at Backcountry, I would have saved about 10% on Backcountry, not worth it.  Hope it was worth the $10.
review.name: It's Fine

review.reviewBody:
Incredibly happy with these. I bought a few for trail running, hiking and working in the yard. They breathe incredibly well, block the sun nicely and don’t snag like some sun clothing tends to do. 

They run slightly large, but most sun clothing seems to. The thumb holes are clutch to reduce knuckle and finger sun burn on long outings above tree line.
review.name: Really really good

review.reviewBody: Bought one for my wife and me. Great breathability, no sunburn in high alpine all day.
review.name: Great product

review.itemreviewed: 7 Seas 3/2mm Full Chest Zip Wetsuit - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I had read reviews saying the Vissla was a great bang for the buck, it is, I wasn't expecting it to be thicker than the other 3/2's, the overall quality and little features are also nicer than most suits in the $239/$249 category.   

I love the stretch of the neoprene and the liner material too. In comparison to other suits in the same price category, it just feels like a more expensive suit.   

I wasn't really looking for a 3/2 to be as thick, but I am happy to have a suit that pushes further into colder temps.  

I got a great deal on mine and even though it wasn't exactly what I was looking for, I am glad I gave Vissla a try, I am really blown away by their quality and little features other brands don't have at this retail price point.  

I would definitely recommend Vissla to anyone.  

With this suit.. Just be ready for something a little warmer than you might expect.  I was almost thinking they sent a 4/3 and had to check to make sure.
review.name: Wasn't expecting such a thick suit.

name: 7 Seas 3/2mm Full Chest Zip Wetsuit - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I was using pipe insulation for when I hauled my boards in the past, it worked fine, but, when I ended up getting a SUP race board is when I knew that way of padding wasn't going to cut it and risking damaging the new board.  
I'm really glad I went with these Dakine pads, they stay in place and have just made one less thing to have to worry about when loading and offloading my boards.  
I would highly recommend these to anyone looking for rack pads.
review.name: A must if you have a rigid race SUP.

review.reviewBody:
I honestly bought a set just for the appearance. I have Yakima Jetstream crossbars on my MDX and it looked like a sled, so I wanted to break up the lines.

Keep in mind that the included padded rolls are designed for smaller crossbars, so if you have the wing-shaped crossbars, you'll need to trim out some of the padding and mount it in the front of the sleeve. Takes a minute to get it right but it looks very nice. The DAKINE print is reflective, so it lights up and I feel it's a nice touch. The Velcro is very strong, so you don't have to worry about it coming loose.
review.name: Great product and looks fire

review.itemreviewed: Entrata Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'm 5'7" and 165 pounds and purchased this bib short (XL) and the Castelli Espresso bib short (XL) as well. The Entrata 2 fit is fine They are a good hot weather short, but wish there was a bit more support around the thighs. The Kiss 2 pad is good only up to 2 hours of riding and after that the cushion experience slowly degrades. However, I found the Kiss 2 pad performed better than the Prgretto X2. YMMV. Next purchase will be Assos GTS bib shorts.
review.name: Decent Short

review.itemreviewed: Entrata Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great bib without breaking the bank. I found it super comfortable, great material, the seams are well made. The chamois is comfortable enough for longer rides. The sizing is correct, I found on the sizing chart where I should be and voila, perfect size, I’m 5’8” , 185 lbs and ordered an XL, my normal size on trousers and jeans is a 33 but this runs small, so be aware, measure yourself and look at the chart, (first time I had to return them).
review.name: Just perfect

review.itemreviewed: Entrata Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have worn a medium in all clothing my adult life and these are not even close. I would say they run very small, not just somewhat small. Costs me $6.99 to try again, which is a little annoying. Hope a better review is coming!
review.name: Runs ridiculously small

review.itemreviewed: Entrata Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This bib short is very comfortable and the Castelli quality is good despite is the 'Entrata' or entry level item.
After reading most of the reviews here indicating that Castelli apparel runs very small, I realised that typical size I wear (Large 'L') will not fit well, hence contacted the Competitive Cyclist team (via chat) and they suggested not one size larger but two so, I ended purchasing the bib short size XL which fits me very well.
review.name: Very good bib once you find your size

review.itemreviewed: Entrata Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Fit perfectly (I am 31 waist and 6'2" and have size M).  Comfortable chammy.
review.name: Great bibs

review.itemreviewed: Entrata Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these bibs after reading the reviews with the anticipation that the 'size' issue wasn't necessarily a significant issue ... I was wrong.  I usually purchase a large bib from most manufacturers, but Castelli I always order up to an XL.  This purchase I did the same, an XL.  Unfortunately, the XL was too small!  The shoulder straps (like others mentioned) were too short and dug into my shoulders.  The bib itself was very tight and way too uncomfortable.  It looks like I'll have to look elsewhere for my bib.
review.name: Wow - runs small ... even for Castelli

review.itemreviewed: Entrata Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: the Chamois absolutely is the star here, ZERO saddle pain, the material also allows for you to move around your saddle with ease, not super tacky. I regret not getting more of these and hope its an item they will re-stock, its that good.
review.name: Beat bib yet

review.itemreviewed: Entrata Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Some riders had some issues with the shorts, but not me. Perhaps body type is relevant. I'm pretty thin and these shorts fit me perfectly. Chamois is extremely comfortable and held up great for 2 hot humid rides over 90 miles. The straps are snug, but I didn't find them uncomfortable or even noticeable after a a short while.
review.name: Excellent Bibs

review.itemreviewed: Entrata Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: As others said the straps are too short for the body and very narrow. The big problem is the pad, which is fairly comfortable but is perforated and absorbs tons of water. After washing they are still sopping wet 2 days later. These are very poor quality sadly
review.name: Not good

review.itemreviewed: Entrata Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
As usual, I sized up to a large on these bibs, I'm a medium  for any other brand.

Fit is typical Castelli, very form fitting, the pad and overall fit is good, but the bib straps are way too short, and I'm only 5' 10". Straps are very uncomfortable.

This may not be an issue for shorter riders, but definitely an issue for taller riders.

I ordered the next model up, the Competitizone, which has a similar fit, but more generous bib straps that don't dig into my shoulders.

I'm returning these and keeping the Competitizone bibs.
review.name: Bib Straps Too Short

name: Entrata Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: I will be seeking a refund for these, but wanted to provide a review here first to caution others from purchasing these. I have a bunch of other POC gear but was utterly blown away by the lack of quality on these gloves. After TWO rides the fabric on outside thumb area is pilling on one glove and the palm material on both gloves is already deteriorating. I cannot fathom how POC can charge $60 for these. I will seriously question buying anything from them ever again after this experience.
review.name: Shockingly bad quality

review.reviewBody: I like the fit, and how breathable they are. Certainly not for cold/wet days. Great Grip. I took a chance to get gloves without a velcro closure for the first time and really like it. They just fit and stay on. Down side is the white grip patches on the fingers came off after just 2-3 rides, but the under layer is still grippy little rubber spots, just not white. Also the "terry cloth" wipe is not that soft. I'd still give them a 5star though.
review.name: Good fit

review.reviewBody: On the moni for sizing and grip is very good!  I love them :)
review.name: Perfect fit and very grippy!

review.reviewBody: This is our second pair of these gloves. We bought on a whim 8 years ago and wear like iron! Fit is snug so if you like a little looser fit buy a size up. Plan on having them for a long time! they do not wear out!
review.name: These gloves are bomb proof!

review.reviewBody: Looks great, and is warm. But shrank beyond normal expectations even when I followed the washing instructions, literally shrank I’d say at least 10-15% easily. Now I’m giving it to a friend that is smaller than me. Sadly this is poorly constructed while the design is brilliant. Jackets however are great but I’ve found t-shirts and now  sweaters run small and that’s before the wash, so plan accordingly is my advice at this price point, that should not happen.
review.name: Shrinks beyond belief

review.reviewBody: I have bought the sweater for a Xmas present. My son is delighted with the hat. Great products and prices. Really pleased with my purchases
review.name: Great quality

review.reviewBody: I love this sweater it’s very warm, like it’s minus 10 and I walk outside with only this sweater on and I’m warm!, the design and the look of it and the craftsmanship is just amazing! And I love the front chest pocket it’s so handy!
review.name: Best sweater ever!

review.reviewBody: The material is so soft and the Men's XS fits me just right (I'm 5'5" 130lb). This sweater goes comfortably from doing chores outside to working in the office. I never want to take it off. Warm but not too warm. Just right!
review.name: My new favorite sweater

review.reviewBody:
I've had mine for a few months and have gotten to wear it a few times. It's been everything I've ever wanted in a wool sweater; warm, hefty, soft, and cozy.

+ It feels solid. I'm tempted to describe it as "heavy", but you really don't feel any kind if weight when wearing it; it's just closer to feeling like a blanket than a shirt, and this is a good thing
+ The wool is soft. It's not as soft as fine merino or alpacca or rabbit fur,  but it's far from a scratchy old blanket or shirt. I'd say it's closest to these soft, cable-knit cotton blankets my grandparents have. I found no irritation with it against my skin.
+ It's warm! I first wore it over a t shirt and under my Greenland No. 1 Special Edition (just G-1000, no insulation) on a brisk 15°F day. It kept me comfortably warm on my walk.
+ It looks really nice, nice enough to wear with more proper business clothes.

- There isn't much to complain about, besides the depth of the pocket; it's a little shallow (my iPhone 7 sticks out a little) and the button can be a little hard to get open at first.

Overall, it's a great sweater, and a go-to for when I'm trying to beat a brisk winter day.
review.name: Your very own "Grandpa's sweater"

review.itemreviewed: Katabatic Mid B-DRY Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought these for a 30 mile backpacking trip a few weeks before - I was in a pinch for new hiking books. These broke in quickly. I wore them consistently 20ish days before the trip for an outdoor job and short hikes. Did pretty well for me. Got a hotspots on my big toes on the last long day of downhill. The hike was pretty rocky, but it seemed like the soles look pretty beat up after only a month of use. Waterproofing is good! Took an accidental stumble into a creek and my sock stayed dry. I would consider these again and recommend to a friend for regular use on dirt/gravel. Just not on rough and rocky terrain. Especially during spring and fall.
review.name: Comfortable - Quick Break In

review.itemreviewed: Katabatic Mid B-DRY Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I thought these would be great to replace some worn a long time Oboz I love.  They are so small I couldn't get my foot into them.  Same size and ostensibly same style I had before.   Not sure what happened here.  My feet are the same.   The boots were great otherwise and I liked the color just fine (although I rarely care unless it's a really ugly color).
review.name: Way too small compared to other Oboz

name: Katabatic Mid B-DRY Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Chilln, climbing, gym… I pretty much where this every where … stretchy and baggy enough to do everything in
review.name: My favorite all round pant

review.reviewBody: these pants are NOT cotton blend as advertised…they are 100% nylon. they feel and sound like somebody cut up a tent and made pants out of the material…horrible.
review.name: not as described

review.reviewBody:
I recently had the urge to buy some "easy pants" and out of 3 different pairs, these were the winners. The Venture pants are just what I had in mind in terms of fit and feel -- they are relaxed but not baggy and still feel like pants. As a bonus, the built in belt actually works great and looks better than having a string dangling off of you all day. Highly recommend them.

The other two pants I tried: 
1) The Roark Layover 2.0 pants were too fitted and there was something a little too 'tech pant' about the material (70% Cotton 26% Nylon 4% Elastane). They also have zipper pockets that are just not that comfortable to slip your hands into.
2) The Topo Designs Dirt Classic pants had a better feel but were also too fitted and had the unforgivable quirk of forgoing a basic button closure, requiring you to tie them on instead. Too weird for me.
review.name: My Definition of "Easy Pant"

review.reviewBody: I bought these to climb in and they don't feel limiting, and I love the styling. I was scared they might be too big because I'm a skinny guy, but they fit just fine and look good. I will be buying a few more pairs.
review.name: Love the look

review.reviewBody: Last year version(white color) has better fit. Overall it's a good buy.
review.name: last year version has better fit

review.reviewBody: The Material these pants are made out of is amazing, not too thin and not to thick with a hint of stretch. Not to mention the colorful pattern on the belt is a nice addition this season. I also like how the back pockets Velcro shut, is a nice level of security while not over doing it.
review.name: Love these pants

name: Venture Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I love Eureka and I love this chair! Easy to carry when I'm out backpacking. Light and small! Adaptable to almost any terrain and comfortable!
review.name: I love this chair!

review.reviewBody: Bought two of the camp stools for my little Cub Scouts for Christmas, and they love them!!  Light yet tough, which is just what we needed.  Previously, my Cubbies were dragging soccer chairs around camp, which were just too heavy for all day hauling around. These camp stools are the perfect solution!  (Daddy and Grandpa tried the stools out too and wanted to know where their stools were. So, now I will be buying two more.)
review.name: the perfect carry-around all day chair

review.reviewBody: Light, comfortable stool...carried along to a trip to the Utah National Parks.
review.name: Loved it!

review.reviewBody: Love these chairs. We have 2 in the truck and will add 2 more to the van. They are the perfect chairs to use while getting your boots on and off or just to chill out. They pair perfectly with our Helinox Table One Hard Top. They also work awesome as footstool with our other lounge chairs for camping. Highly recommend!
review.name: never go anywhere without them

hasVariant.name: Candy 1 Pedals
hasVariant.description: Buy the Crank Brothers Candy 1 Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Had a set of these for a couple of weeks when I was making the transition from flats to clips on my trail bike. They're decently light weight but the feeling of clipping in and out was very vague - like I wasn't ever sure if I was clipped in without lifting my foot and clipping out never seemed to be at the same point of rotation of my foot. There's no functional adjustment other than the brass cleats but swapping them out didn't help much. Ended up giving them to a friend who likes CB pedals and picked up a set of SPDs which was a much better decision.
review.name: Light but vague feeling

review.reviewBody: I have used these pedals for xc racing for about 10 years. When you consider the weight and the price there is nothing even close. I will say these are mean to replace after a significant amount of wear. I usually buy 1 set every 2 years or so of hard riding. I love em. easy to get in especially if your starting on a hill or other technical terrain where you need somewhat of a flat pedal to get established.
review.name: best light cost effective xc pedal

review.reviewBody: They are probably better for road biking/xc where coming unclipped won't hurt you. But when used for jumps you come unclipped way to easily. If you are considering taking these downhill, forget it. YOU WILL COME UNCLIPPED TOO EASILY TOO FAST!!!
review.name: NO GRIP!

review.reviewBody: Use these on my gravel/ commuter bike and work great.  Stepped up to these from egg beaters for some increased platform size and decreased foot pressure
review.name: Great pedal, great price

review.reviewBody: I've put maybe 200 miles on these finicky pedals and they re-payed me with a failure to keep my feet locked in. The retention system bent while pedaling and suddenly released on a descent causing me to crash. Spent the rest of that ride with my foot consistently releasing while pedaling on the road. I don't write many reviews on BC, but after having this happen to me I figured I'd give a heads up.
review.name: Caused me to crash on a descent

name: Candy 1 Pedals

review.reviewBody: This is a lovely, stylish, warm puffer coat, with a slim fit. We recently had a cold snap, with temps dropping to 5 degrees and it kept me toasty with just a light sweater underneath. As others have said, this coat runs small. For reference, I’m 5’ 6.5”, 138 and bought a large, in navy and it fits very close to the body.
review.name: Love my Marmot Montreal!

review.reviewBody: The jacket is beautiful. Why it gets 4 stars is because I always where a medium with plenty of room to wear sweaters under, and this jacket is tight around the shoulders and chest.
review.name: Beautiful jacket runs small

review.reviewBody: I had to return as the coat as it was way too big for me. People online stated it ran too small and that they had to size up. If I would've bought my normal size, I would have been fine, but unfortunately my regular size had since sold out.
review.name: Returned
comment:
Hello,

Thank you for providing us with feedback on our Women's Montreal Coat. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.

We are very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.

We will make sure to forward your feedback about the sizing to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon.-Fri. 9AM - 5PM EST. 

Thank you!
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wife loves this jacket. She said it’s warm and perfect for cold weather.
review.name: Wife loves it.

review.reviewBody: I have this jacket now in two colors. Love it. Warm, lightweight.
review.name: Down Jacky

review.reviewBody: This coat is losing it's down fill.  I've submitted a warranty claim to Marmot but haven't gotten a response.  It's apparent the shell is substandard.  They do have a lifetime warranty so our assumption is it will be resovled.
review.name: losing fill rapidly

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It’s a great down coat for the Winter. It’s warm and cozy. The hoody is great for the snow.
review.name: Monteal  Coat

review.reviewBody: Got this for my wife's birthday and it's become her daily outer layer. She loves how warm it feels and that it looks great for the city.
review.name: She won't leave it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great! 2020 version has held up for 4 years. Excited to get a new one
review.name: Great! 2020 version has held up for 4 years

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It keeps me warm and it’s fashionable. I like the look of the small but it was too tight in the shoulders and chest which isn’t ideal for layering and zipping. I returned the small for a medium. It’s a touch big but layers well.
review.name: Warm and Fashionable

description: Buy the Icebreaker Queens Clasp Bra - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Queens Clasp Bra - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Icebreaker Queens Clasp Bra - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The bra fits me perfectly. It is comfortable and I love the material!
review.name: Just what I wanted

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable! I have been almost exclusively wearing this style for 2 years. My previous bras are getting a little old, so this is a replacement. I wish the band didn't fold/bend and the the seams were less obvious.
review.name: Great bra

review.reviewBody: Like other reviewers, this was too tight across my ribs. I am very small and made sure I measured correctly as well. I ended up trying two different bra extenders, again just like another reviewer hoping it would work, but it didn't, it just made the shoulder straps sit on my shoulder blades instead, which became extremely uncomfortable. The bra fit perfect elsewhere and was so comfortable that I debated on keeping it, but the longer I tried it on the worse the feeling on my shoulder blades got. I might try to order a small later when the purple is back in stock, and hope it fits better.
review.name: Band too tight

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm a small old woman, and had used cheap pullover stretch bras for many years. I usually looked rather flat-chested or "smushed" but I was comfortable. However, when I first tried on my Queen's clasp bra (which I only pullover and never unclasp) I suddenly had a smooth bust-line with two distinct breasts! No smush! Not only that but instead of synthetic fibers I'm supported by soft natural merino wool. Since buying this bra I have ordered two more!! I wish they made a beige or white shade though. Oh, the tags were annoying but turned out to be very easy to remove.
review.name: Great bra!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bra is breathable, comfy and it packs really well for travel
review.name: This bra is so comfortable and perfect for travel

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] As many reviewers said, this bra is too tight. So unfortunate. I have a small back and was hoping this bra would work for me. The cup size was perfect and so comfortable I carefully measured myself before ordering because of other reviews. I wish you would make these wider. In your measurement, are you not allowing extra fabric for the part where the hooks are?
review.name: I wanted to love this but . . .

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bra fits me perfectly ans is really comfortable. I bought black a d would now buy another in a more neutral color. I probably won't wear it on hot, muggy days but other than that, it's great.
review.name: The best fitting bra I own

review.reviewBody: Cups fit great, but the band is way too tight, guess I will size up to an XL and see if I can wear it without an extender even though I am actually a medium. I will buy the purple because I love purple, but why, oh why, can't you make this in a nice neutral color like beige or gray?
review.name: Love it, hate it.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The elastic band is fully encased in wool (a must for me) and the hook back is great. Would love a lighter color and larger cup sizes. Wool is super soft and moisture wicking.
review.name: One of my favourites

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The cups fit but the back closure is 2-4 inches too short. This is the only merino bra I found that is not a sports pullover Waiting to see if they restock the xl , but now it's on clearance
review.name: Band is short

name: Queens Clasp Bra - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Low Key Glow Up Sandal - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these from another retailer, but when I saw them here while looking for sandals, I thought to share my review. I found these to be poorly made and wildly uncomfortable. They do not stand up to other shoes in their price range and are difficult to fit- I ordered a 7 (am usually a 7.5) based on recs from the other retailer. I returned them immediately after wearing around my apartment.
review.name: Too cheap

review.reviewBody: Good winter and low temp jacket. Its longer and a tad baggy/active since its made for riding, so take your normal size and layer underneath for really cold days. It's super comfortable and will keep you warm and dry. Hood is definitely a little too Raph, it's made for riding with a helmet on, so its too big for casual wear but I knew that would be the case for any snowboard jacket so it doesn't bother me.
review.name: Everything you need to stay comfortable in the elements

review.reviewBody: I've been itching for a cold day ski jacket.  This baby is perfect.  On the roomy side, super warm, windproof, good style.  All the right pockets.  Love it.  I'm 5'10" 210 pounds and large fits without any restriction and room for a mid layer.
review.name: Perfect Cold Weather Resort Jaclet

review.reviewBody: Great Ski Jacket! This was a gift for my son. He loved it and was impressed by the avalanche sensor that is built into the sleeve. The fit was perfect with lots of pockets to stow away belongings as he is skiing.
review.name: Great ski jacket

name: First Tracks Down Jacket - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the SRAM Red eTap AXS Front Derailleur - 2024 online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This replaced a Rival AXS front derailleur. Installation was the same as setting up a mech front derailleur, even with the setup tool, but configuration was easy.  I’m not sure what warranted the extra money. It wasn’t that much lighter, it looked the same as the Rival, which I thought looked better and it shifted the same. I borderline regret replacing my the Rival F derailleur. I could have used the money to get new tires, tools or other bike doodads.
review.name: Does the same job Rival AXS does…

name: Red eTap AXS Front Derailleur - 2024
